author: ansa.it
title: Carabiniere ucciso a colpi di arma da fuoco nel Brindisino - Notizie - Ansa.it
text:
Un carabiniere è stato ucciso all'alba a colpi di arma da fuoco durante un'attività di controllo nella zona industriale di Francavilla Fontana, in provincia di Brindisi, in contrada Rosea. Sono ancora poco chiare le dinamiche dell'accaduto. Non si esclude che il militare sia stato colpito durante il controllo di un'auto.
La vittima è un brigadiere in servizio nella compagnia di Francavilla Fontana.
Secondo le prime ricostruzioni, la sparatoria in cui il militare è stato ucciso sarebbe avvenuta al termine dell'inseguimento di un'auto sulla strada che collega Francavilla a Grottaglie.
Le persone a bordo del veicolo in fuga sarebbero scese dall'auto e avrebbero sparato. Sul posto c'è il pm di turno, Raffaele Casto.

author: Katie Akin
title: Ron DeSantis slams Nikki Haley for omitting slavery as Civil War cause
text:
ANKENY, Iowa — Republican presidential candidate Ron DeSantis slammed opponent Nikki Haley for giving "a really incomprehensible word salad" answer when she was asked in New Hampshire what caused the Civil War. During a Wednesday town hall in Berlin, New Hampshire, a voter asked Haley, “What was the cause of the United States Civil War?”
“Well, don’t come with an easy question or anything," Haley responded. "I mean, I think the cause of the Civil War was basically how the government was going to run. The freedoms and what people could and couldn’t do.”
Haley never mentioned slavery in her answer, drawing backlash from her Republican and Democratic rivals. On Thursday, Haley said "of course the Civil War was about slavery," and she suggested the question came from a Democratic plant in the audience.
DeSantis was quick to criticize Haley at an Ankeny campaign stop Thursday morning. He told reporters she is "not a candidate that's ready for prime time."
"The minute that she faces any kind of scrutiny, she tends to cave," DeSantis said. "I think that that's what you saw yesterday. Not that difficult to identify and acknowledge the role slavery played in the Civil War, and yet that seemed to be something that was really difficult."
DeSantis claimed the abolition of slavery was a "partisan achievement."
"The Republican Party was founded to put a stop to the growth of slavery in this country. And the abolition of slavery was — and to this day, remains — the party's top achievement," he said.
But DeSantis faced his own gauntlet of questions about slavery and the legacy of the Civil War.
A reporter asked about a curriculum standard approved in Florida that "includes how slaves developed skills which, in some instances, could be applied for their personal benefit." The language earned Florida and DeSantis scorn, including from U.S. Sen. Tim Scott, who at the time was a presidential candidate before later dropping out.
DeSantis cut off the reporter's question about the standard: "That's a fake narrative," he said. "We've now had a whole semester that's happened. Have you seen examples of (teachers) saying what the media was saying this summer? No."
DeSantis said the standard was "bastardized" intentionally to "create a narrative."
"Florida's standards were written largely by African-Americans, and they were accurate, and any of those narratives are false," he said.
Another reporter asked DeSantis to comment on Jacksonville, Florida, Mayor Donna Deegan's removal of a Confederate monument.
"I'm opposed to taking down statues," DeSantis said. "The idea that we're going to just erase history is wrong."
USA Today contributed reporting.
Katie Akin is a politics reporter for the Register. Reach her at kakin@registermedia.com . Follow her on Twitter at @katie_akin .

title: Pathlight Seniorcare Services Reinforces Its Commitment to Senior Care in Mountain Brook, AL | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Pathlight Seniorcare Services in Mountain Brook, AL, reaffirms its commitment to providing exceptional home care for seniors. Tailored to enhance comfort and well-being, their personalized care plans ensure seniors live fulfilling lives with dignity. For top-quality senior care, visit https://pathlightseniorcare.com Mountain Brook, AL - Pathlight Seniorcare Services, a prominent figure in senior care, today reaffirmed its commitment to the residents of Mountain Brook, AL, by continuing to offer unparalleled home care services. This announcement reassures local families seeking high-quality senior care in Mountain Brook, AL, for their loved ones, ensuring that they receive outstanding support tailored to enhance comfort and well-being within their homes. This enduring pledge is in response to the consistent demand from the community for dependable, superior home care solutions, emphasizing the significance of individualized care plans and the holistic welfare of each senior entrusted to their care.
"Pathlight Seniorcare Services stands by its mission to provide exceptional care and support to the seniors of Mountain Brook, ensuring they lead fulfilling lives with dignity and independence," stated Orrett Bailey, owner of Pathlight Seniorcare Services. "Our unwavering dedication to this goal drives us to continually adapt and meet the evolving needs of our community, guaranteeing that each family and senior we serve experience the compassionate, personalized care they truly merit."
Pathlight Seniorcare Services' approach to senior care is deeply personalized, aiming to meet the distinct needs of each client. From essential assistance with daily living activities to addressing comprehensive care requirements, this bespoke approach assures seniors an enhanced quality of life, promoting autonomy, comfort, and overall well-being.
Families in Mountain Brook, AL, searching for exemplary senior care services can turn to Pathlight Seniorcare Services for their loved ones’ needs.
For more information about Pathlight Seniorcare Services and their senior care in Mountain Brook, AL , please visit their website at https://pathlightseniorcare.com
About Pathlight Seniorcare Services, LLC:
Pathlight Seniorcare Services is a leading provider of senior care services in Mountain Brook, AL. Renowned for its commitment to quality and a team of dedicated care professionals, Pathlight Seniorcare Services delivers a wide range of services designed to cater to the varied needs of the senior population. Dedicated to improving the lives of seniors and their families, Pathlight Seniorcare Services continues to be the preferred choice for those seeking compassionate, high-quality care in the comfort of their homes.

author: admin
title: St. George Tabernacle Continues To Bring The Community Together In 2025 - The Independent
text:
With an amazing schedule of events, sure to warm the hearts of all who enter during the holidays, the Historic St. George Tabernacle reopened for tours and events beginning December 1st, 2024, following an eight-month closure for needed renovations. St. George Tabernacle January 2025 Events Calendar December 2024 — So far, over a dozen wonderful performances have occurred in the Historic St. George Tabernacle in December! As we near Christmas day, we invite you to join in celebrating the Savior’s birth during any (or all) of the remaining Tabernacle performances in 2025.
The following events are scheduled at the St. George Tabernacle for the month of January 2025. All events are free to the public. Beginning the last week of December, recordings of events can also be heard by dialing 435-677-6230 and depressing #3. If you wish to schedule an event in the St. George Tabernacle, contact Sister Pamela Nead, Southwest Historic Sites Mission, 206-437-2976.
January 2025 Tabernacle Events Wednesday, January 1 – 12:00 p.m.: “Prayer Over the City,” a wonderful way to welcome in the new year! This 1-hour program features 16 area religious leaders from the St George Interfaith Council offering short, focused prayers. “St George Interfaith Choir” adds wonderful music to this patriotic and inspiring opportunity to enjoy community togetherness.
Monday, January 6 – 12:00 Noon: “The Legacy Lecture Series” will commence its 2025 season series with Kurt Ivie. Ivie was elected to the Washington City Council in 2019 and again in 2023. He serves on the Utah State Legislative Policy Water Working Board.
Friday, January 17 – 7:00 p.m.: “Bar None Wranglers” returns to perform well known traditional musical selections with an invitation for audience participation. Plan for a nostalgic evening of fun!
Saturday, January 18 – 7:00 p.m.: Come hear descendants’ testimonies in “Voices of the Restoration.” Speakers include: For Joseph Smith, Jr., Gracia Jones—2nd Great Granddaughter of Joseph and Emma Smith and David Joseph Denning—3rd Great Grandson of Joseph and Emma Smith. For Hyrum Smith, Joseph Fife—3rd Great Grandson. For Brigham Young, Luann Spiers—2nd Great Granddaughter (through Lucy Bigelow Young). For John Taylor, Joel Taylor—3rd Great Grandson. For Parley P. Pratt, Paul Gooch—3rd Great Grandson. For Thomas Callister, Thomas Callister—3rd Great Grandson.
Saturday, January 25 – 7:00 p.m.: “Second Chance Band” returns to delight with Bluegrass and Celtic music, featuring bluegrass songs such as Man of Constant Sorrow, Tennessee Waltz, Wayfaring Stranger, and Irish tunes Her Mantel so Green, Come Thou Fount, and May the Road Rise Up to Meet You. Musicians include Becky Loftus (violin), Ethan Deceuster (guitar), Nils Lingwall (accordion), and Beth Lingwall (flute, banjo and mandolin).
Sunday, January 26 – 7:00 p.m.: “David J. Ridges,” scholar and prolific LDS author, will present “The Doctrine and Covenants.” Enjoy messages and specific verses that address issues of daily life and which answer common questions about staying firmly on the covenant path. Plan to bring your scriptures!
Thursday, January 30 – 7:00 p.m.: Join the “AHS A cappella Choir,” a 75-voice mixed choral ensemble from American Fork, Utah’s American Heritage School (est. 1970), a Christian-oriented private school. The eclectic performance will include pieces by Dan Forrest, W. A. Mozart, Vaclovas Augustinas, Ralph Vaughan Williams, and the choir’s director, Rob Swenson.
Source link

title: HONOR Pad 9 ya se puede comprar en México: así puedes obtener un cupón de 1,500 pesos de descuento y regalos adicionales
text: La HONOR Pad 9 es la nueva tableta que la marca china ha traído a nuestro país y ahora es posible adquirirla en su [tienda oficial](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Fshop%2F) por un precio de [9,999 pesos](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Ftablets%2Fhonor-pad-9%2Fbuy%2F). Pero por lanzamiento la marca ha liberado un cupón con 1,500 pesos de descuento, así como regalos de hasta 5,000 pesos. HONOR Pad 9 Para obtener los regalos, únicamente debes [ir al enlace de la tablet](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Ftablets%2Fhonor-pad-9%2Fbuy%2F), en donde al seleccionar el modelo y el color, verás que la misma tienda agrega automáticamente tres regalos. El primero es un HONOR Watch 4, con precio de [2,999 pesos](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Fwearables%2Fhonor-watch-4%2Fbuy%2F), más una HONOR Band 7, con precio de [1,299 pesos](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Fwearables%2Fhonor-band-7%2Fbuy%2F), y una funda completa para la tablet con precio de [999 pesos](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Faccessories%2Fhonor-pad-9-flip-cover%2Fbuy%2F). Una vez agregado en el carrito, debes añadir el código de descuento ABNMXPAD9N con el que se hará una rebaja adicional de 1,500 pesos, dejando el precio en [8,499 pesos](https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=50221&awinaffid=1088499&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.honor.com%2Fmx%2Ftablets%2Fhonor-pad-9%2Fbuy%2F). Por si fuera poco, la tienda también regala la garantía extendida por hasta un año y un seguro de pantalla por seis meses. Ahora mismo, la tienda oficial de HONOR ofrece pagos hasta en 18 mensualidades sin intereses, envío gratuito a cualquier parte de México en compras mayores a 500 pesos y pagos directos o a través de Mercado Pago.
